field_desc: Shape identifier created by ArcGIS processing tool

The route_id field contains an ID that uniquely identifies a route. The route_id is dataset unique.Note that because this layer is a combination of two agency datasets, route_id may not be unique unless combined with the agency_id field
The agency_id field defines an agency for the specified route. This value is referenced from the agency.txt file. MTS = San Diego Metrolpolitan Transit SystemNCTD = North County Transit District
The route_desc field contains a description of a route which may provide useful, quality information.

The route_type field describes the type of transportation used on a route. Valid values for this field are:0 - Tram, Streetcar, Light rail. Any light rail or street level system within a metropolitan area (includes Trolley)1 - Subway, Metro. Any underground rail system within a metropolitan area. 2 - Rail. Used for intercity or long-distance travel. 3 - Bus. Used for short- and long-distance bus routes. 4 - Ferry. Used for short- and long-distance boat service. 5 - Cable car. Used for street-level cable cars where the cable runs beneath the car. 6 - Gondola, Suspended cable car. Typically used for aerial cable cars where the car is suspended from the cable. 7 - Funicular. Any rail system designed for steep inclines.
The route_url field contains the URL of a web page about that particular route. This should be different from the agency_url.
Route Shape Name created by by the ArcGIS  processing tool.

The route_short_name contains the short name of a route. This will often be a short, abstract identifier like "32", "100X", or "Green" that riders use to identify a route, but which doesn't give any indication of what places the route serves. At least one of route_short_name or route_long_name must be specified, or potentially both if appropriate.

The route_long_name contains the full name of a route. This name is generally more descriptive than the route_short_name and will often include the route's destination or stop. At least one of route_short_name or route_long_name must be specified, or potentially both if appropriate.
Route Type Text - text value for Route Type.  Created by the ArcGIS tool used to create the routes layer.

In systems that have colors assigned to routes, the route_color field defines a color that corresponds to a route. The color is provided as a six-character hexadecimal number, for example, 00FFFF. If no color is specified, the default route color is white (FFFFFF).

Route Color RGB value.  Created by the ArcGIS tool used to develop the GIS layer. Hexadecimal format route color converted to a RGB triplet that can more easily be used as reference when choosing symbology in ArcMap

The route_text_color field can be used to specify a legible color to use for text drawn against a background of route_color. The color is provided as a six-character hexadecimal number, for example, FFD700. If no color is specified, the default text color is black (000000).

Route Text Color RGB value.  Created by the ArcGIS tool used to develop the GIS layer. Hexadecimal format route color converted to a RGB triplet that can more easily be used as reference when choosing symbology in ArcMap
